p: Antiobesity treatment protocols recommend the regulation of food intake and also intake agents which affect the absorption of dietary fat, metabolism, and storage of fats [ 31]. Orlistat is a potent inhibitor of gastric and pancreatic lipase, which is a hydrogenated derivative of lipstatin, produced by Streptomyces toxytricini and acts by diminishing the absorption of dietary fat. Orlistat forms a covalent bond with the active serine site of lipases and thus inactivates them to hydrolyze dietary fat. It has several side effects including flatulence, incontinence, fecal urgency, fat-soluble vitamin deficiencies, abdominal cramping, steatorrhea, and liquid stools [ 32].
